description:
An open-source alternative to Claude Cowork, powered by OpenCode

OpenWork is an extensible, open-source “Claude Work” style system for knowledge workers.
It’s a native desktop app that runs OpenCode under the hood, but presents it as a clean, guided workflow:
- pick a workspace
- start a run
- watch progress + plan updates
- approve permissions when needed
- reuse what works (templates + skills)
The goal: make “agentic work” feel like a product, not a terminal.
Highlights
- opencode-router (formerly owpenbot): openwrk TUI Router tab now shows Telegram/Slack identities, token setup, and a groups toggle; removes the dead WhatsApp QR flow.
- New CLI alias opencode-router (keeping owpenbot/owpenwork) plus clearer health-port errors (OPENCODE_ROUTER_HEALTH_PORT, OWPENBOT_HEALTH_PORT, or PORT).
Fixes & polish
- Hide reverted messages immediately in the session UI.
Packaging / ops
- AUR metadata updated for 0.11.68.
